title: Tab Tours Inner - Comprehensive Usage Examples
description: Child block for tp-tabs-tours parent, represents individual tab items with clickable button and content panel
architectureNote: CRITICAL: This is a CHILD BLOCK that must be inside tpgb/tp-tabs-tours parent. It cannot be inserted independently (inserter: false). The parent tabs block controls overall layout (horizontal/vertical), styling, and behavior. Each tp-tab-item represents one clickable tab button + its content panel.

validationRules.tabinTitle: Required, the text shown in tab button (5-15 characters recommended)
validationRules.tabtoIndex: Required, 0-based index matching position in parent tabs (first tab = 0)
validationRules.uniqueKey: Required for tracking, recommended format: 'tab_' + index
validationRules.activeTab: Optional, 1-based (first tab = 1). Only set to 1 for the default active tab
validationRules.innerIcon: Boolean, set to true to show icon in tab button
validationRules.iconFonts: Required if innerIcon is true, options: 'font_awesome' or 'image'
validationRules.innericonName: Required if iconFonts is 'font_awesome', FontAwesome class (e.g., 'fas fa-home')
validationRules.iconImage: Required if iconFonts is 'image', object with url and Id
validationRules.iconImageSize: WordPress image size for custom icons: 'thumbnail', 'medium', 'large', 'full'
validationRules.innerBlocks: Array of child blocks, supports any tpgb block for rich content

warnings: CRITICAL: This is a CHILD BLOCK that MUST be inside tpgb/tp-tabs-tours parent - cannot be used independently (inserter: false)
CRITICAL: tabtoIndex must match position in parent tabs (0-based: first tab = 0, second = 1, third = 2)
uniqueKey must be unique across all tabs within the same parent tp-tabs-tours
activeTab is 1-based (first tab = 1) while tabtoIndex is 0-based (first tab = 0) - don't confuse them!
Only ONE tab should have activeTab: 1 to be shown by default (multiple tabs with activeTab: 1 causes conflicts)
innerIcon requires iconFonts and innericonName/iconImage to be set (all three work together)
Parent tp-tabs-tours controls overall tab styling (colors, borders, typography) - individual tabs can't override
Tab content is hidden until tab is clicked (use lazy loading for heavy content like videos)
navAlign only affects tab button text, not the button itself (parent controls button layout)
iconImage should be small icons (30-40px), not large images (breaks tab button layout)
Don't use more than 8-10 tabs in one parent (UX and mobile concerns - consider accordion or pagination)
tabinTitle should be concise (long titles break mobile layout)
Each innerBlock needs unique block_id to avoid React rendering issues
Heavy content (videos, forms, galleries) inside tabs loads on tab activation (lazy load)
Parent tp-tabs-tours mode (horizontal/vertical) affects how tabs are displayed
commonMistakes: Trying to insert tp-tab-item directly without parent tpgb/tp-tabs-tours (won't work - inserter disabled)
Not matching tabtoIndex with actual position in parent tabs (causes wrong tab to activate)
Confusing activeTab (1-based) with tabtoIndex (0-based) - common source of bugs
Setting multiple tabs with activeTab: 1 (only first tab should be default active)
Forgetting uniqueKey (breaks tab tracking and switching)
Setting innerIcon: true but forgetting innericonName or iconImage (icon won't show)
Using large images for iconImage (should be small icons 30-40px)
Using tabinTitle with 20+ characters (breaks mobile layout, use 5-15 characters)
Not providing block_id for innerBlocks (can cause rendering issues)
Setting navAlign on individual tabs thinking it affects layout (parent controls layout)
Adding too many tabs (8+) without considering mobile UX (tabs become tiny)
Forgetting to set iconFonts when innerIcon is true (defaults to font_awesome but should be explicit)
Using iconImageSize 'full' for icons (use 'thumbnail' for small icons)
Not coordinating activeTab with parent's defaultTab attribute
Using generic titles like 'Tab 1', 'Tab 2' (bad UX and accessibility)
Not testing tab content on mobile (vertical stacking, smaller viewports)
bestPractices: Always test tab items within their parent tpgb/tp-tabs-tours context
Keep tabinTitle concise: 5-15 characters ideal (e.g., 'Features', 'Pricing', 'FAQ')
Use uniqueKey format 'tab_0', 'tab_1', etc. for consistency
Set activeTab: 1 only for the first tab (or whichever should show by default)
Use innerIcon to categorize tabs visually (dollar for pricing, cog for settings, etc.)
Keep tabtoIndex sequential (0, 1, 2, 3) matching visual order
Limit total tabs to 5-7 for optimal UX (more tabs = harder to scan)
Use horizontal tabs for 3-5 items, vertical tabs for 6+ items
Provide meaningful tab titles that work standalone (users scan tabs before clicking)
Structure tab content with headings for hierarchy (h3 for main sections)
Use tp-stylist-list for bullet points inside tab content
Add CTAs (tp-button) at the end of tab content when appropriate
Test mobile responsiveness - parent tabs may switch to accordion mode
Use iconImageSize 'thumbnail' for custom icon images (30-40px)
Coordinate with parent's tabLayout (horizontal/vertical) and tabEffect (slide/fade)
Keep heavy content (videos, galleries) minimal per tab for performance
Use consistent icon library (font_awesome) across all tabs
For code documentation, use <pre> and <code> tags in tp-pro-paragraph
Consider using tp-tabs-tours for horizontal navigation, tp-accordion for FAQ-style content
Group related tabs (all features, all pricing tiers, all support topics)
Use navAlign: 'text-center' for balanced tabs, 'text-left' for text-heavy content
Test keyboard navigation (Tab to focus, Enter to activate, Arrow keys to switch tabs)
Provide clear visual feedback for active tab (parent controls styling)
Don't nest tabs inside tabs (use tp-switcher or tp-accordion for sub-navigation)

parentControls.styling: Parent controls all visual styling (colors, borders, shadows, typography)
parentControls.layout: Parent controls tab layout (horizontal/vertical), alignment, spacing
parentControls.behavior: Parent controls tab switching effects (fade/slide), default active tab
parentControls.responsive: Parent may switch to accordion mode on mobile (responsive setting)

childControls.content: Child controls tab button title (tabinTitle) and panel content (innerBlocks)
childControls.icon: Child can add optional icon in tab button (innerIcon, innericonName)
childControls.index: Child must coordinate tabtoIndex with parent array position
childControls.uniqueKey: Child sets unique identifier for tab tracking

tabtoIndex.description: 0-based index for internal tracking and coordination with parent
tabtoIndex.values: First tab = 0, Second tab = 1, Third tab = 2, etc.
tabtoIndex.usage: Must match actual position in parent's tabs array
tabtoIndex.critical: If tabtoIndex doesn't match position, wrong tab content will show

activeTab.description: 1-based indicator for default active tab (shown on page load)
activeTab.values: First tab = 1, Second tab = 2, Third tab = 3, etc.
activeTab.usage: Set to 1 for the tab that should be active by default (usually first tab)
activeTab.critical: Only ONE tab should have activeTab: 1 to avoid conflicts

secondTab.note: Second tab, not active by default (activeTab can be 0 or omitted)

thirdTab.note: Third tab, activeTab not set (defaults to inactive)

accessibilityConsiderations: Tabs are keyboard accessible (Tab to focus, Enter to activate, Arrow keys to switch between tabs)
ARIA attributes automatically added (role='tablist', aria-selected, aria-controls)
Tab button text (tabinTitle) is read by screen readers - make it descriptive
innerIcon should be decorative (aria-hidden='true') - meaning conveyed in tabinTitle
Use semantic HTML in tab content (headings, lists, paragraphs) for screen reader navigation
Ensure sufficient color contrast for tab buttons (active vs inactive states)
Test with keyboard: Tab (focus), Enter (activate), Left/Right Arrow (switch tabs)
Parent tabs may convert to accordion on mobile for better touch accessibility
Provide clear visual feedback for active tab (parent styling handles this)
Don't rely solely on color to indicate active tab (use underline, bold, or other visual cues)
performanceOptimization: Tab content is lazy-loaded - content only rendered when tab becomes active
Heavy content (videos, carousels, large images) won't impact initial page load
CSS-based tab switching (display: none/block) is performant
Use image lazy loading inside tab content (WordPress native lazy='loading')
Parent tabs use CSS transitions for smooth switching (GPU-accelerated)
Limit innerBlocks to essential content per tab (don't nest complex layouts unnecessarily)
Consider using Swiper effect (parent setting) for touch-friendly mobile tabs
Test mobile performance - tabs may switch to accordion for better UX
Total tabs recommended limit: 7-8 tabs per parent (UX and performance)
SVG icons (innerIcon with FontAwesome) perform better than image icons

solutions: Verify you're inside a tpgb/tp-tabs-tours parent block
Check parent tabs has space for new items
Try adding tab via parent tabs' 'Add Tab' control instead
Check browser console for JavaScript errors

troubleshooting.issue: Wrong tab content shows when clicked
solutions: Verify tabtoIndex matches actual position (0-based: first=0, second=1)
Check uniqueKey is unique across all tabs
Verify no duplicate tabtoIndex values across tabs
Check parent tabs structure hasn't been corrupted

troubleshooting.issue: No tab is active by default / wrong tab is active
solutions: Verify only ONE tab has activeTab: 1 (not multiple)
Check first tab has activeTab: 1 if it should be default
Verify parent's defaultTab attribute coordinates with child activeTab
Clear browser cache and test in incognito mode

troubleshooting.issue: Icon not showing in tab button
solutions: Verify innerIcon is set to true (not false)
Check iconFonts is set ('font_awesome' or 'image')
For FontAwesome: verify innericonName has valid class (e.g., 'fas fa-home')
For image: verify iconImage has valid url
Verify FontAwesome is loaded on the page (parent theme/plugins)
Check for CSS conflicts hiding the icon
Reduce tabinTitle length (use 5-15 characters max)
Test parent's responsive settings (may need to switch to vertical or accordion)
Check parent tab button width settings
Test on actual mobile device (not just resized browser)
Check parent's tabEffect setting ('fade' vs 'slide')
Verify no JavaScript errors in browser console
Check innerBlocks don't have CSS position:fixed (breaks animation)
Test without browser extensions (some interfere with animations)
Clear browser cache and test in incognito mode
